headline: Two children, ages 4 and 6, missing in Pictou County | CBC News
context: RCMP in Nova Scotia’s Pictou County have put out a public appeal for help in finding two children who have been missing since this morning when it’s believed they wandered away from a home.
CBC News  · Posted: May 02, 2025 12:17 PM EDT | Last Updated: 8 hours ago

annotations.paragraph: RCMP in Nova Scotia's Pictou County have put out a public appeal for help to find two children who have been missing since this morning when it's believed they wandered away from a home.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides the main information about the missing children and the public appeal.

annotations.paragraph: Police said Lily Sullivan, 6, and Jack Sullivan, 4, were last seen on Gairloch Road in Lansdowne Station, about 20 kilometres southwest of New Glasgow, N.S.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides specific details about the location and identities of the missing children.

annotations.paragraph: A search involving police and other agencies is underway. A helicopter from the Department of Natural Resources is helping.
annotations.reason: This paragraph describes the ongoing search efforts, which is relevant to the situation.

annotations.paragraph: RCMP spokesperson Cpl. Carlie McCann said the children left a home and were reported missing at 10 a.m. They are believed to have wandered, she said. There's no evidence they were abducted, so no Amber Alert was issued.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides important context about the circumstances of the disappearance and the decision not to issue an Amber Alert.

annotations.paragraph: Lily has shoulder-length light brown hair with bangs. RCMP said she might be wearing a pink sweater, pink pants and pink boots. Jack has short blondish hair. He was wearing blue dinosaur boots.
annotations.reason: This paragraph gives a detailed description of the children's appearances, which is crucial for identification.

annotations.paragraph: Anyone with information about the children is urged to call Pictou County District RCMP at 902-485-4333.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides essential contact information for the public to assist in the search for the missing children.
